intro: Volutaria abyssinica subsp. inornata, commonly known as the Abyssinian velvetleaf, is a herbaceous plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinct pubescent surface. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insect species.
